snippet: The government has issued arrest warrants after clashes that left dozens dead in the Xinjiang region. A newspaper linked the rise in violence to Uighurs it said had trained in Syria.
abstract: Chinese authorities tighten grip on far western region of Xinjiang, where violent clashes occurred, confiscating knives and issuing arrest warrants for 11 people said to be wanted for murder, bombings and other violence; drive has been accompanied by accusations of extremism among minority Uighur group.

byline.original: By ANDREW JACOBS and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Andrew Jacobs reported from Beijing, and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong. Patrick Zuo contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The government has issued arrest warrants after clashes that left dozens dead in the Xinjiang region. A newspaper linked the rise in violence to Uighurs it said had trained in Syria.
